poem:
Title: "In the Shadow of Detritus"

Monstrous mountains breed,
Where mankind's scorn has seeded.
Poverty's banquet for vermin,
A stench of rot, a festering sermon.
Delhi drowns in discarded dreams,
Echoing methane's silent screams.
There towers the testament, bleak and wide,
Of the refuse we deny and hide.
In Ghazipur, Bhalswa, and Okhla's strife,
Thrive monuments of our wasted life.
